channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Some Of The Largest Book Publishers Are Hiring AI Engineers
item.description: Publishing giants like Penguin Random House and Macmillan are eager to use AI internally—but not for writing or editing. Their authors still might rev...

item.title: Why President Trump’s latest crypto scandal could spell disaster for the blockchain industry
item.description: A bombshell report revealed that an Abu Dhabi royal bought a 49% stake in Trump’s flagship crypto project.

item.title: Moltbook, the viral social media site for AI bots, contains a ‘lethal trifecta’ for how the agent internet could fail, security researchers say
item.description: “If toy agents on a Reddit clone can create this much chaos, what happens when agentic systems manage enterprise infrastructure or financial transacti...

item.title: Jabra Unveils New And Expandable Audio And Video Solutions For Meeting Rooms
item.description: Jabra’s new PanaCast 55 VBS, PanaCast SpeakerMic and PanaCast Room Kits are part of a new portfolio of expandable meeting room solutions that can adap...

item.title: AI is changing the CEO’s role—and could lead to a changing of the guard
item.description: Even seasoned CEOs must show they can match the speed of technological change—and generate tangible returns from investments in it.

item.title: Convicts, Chaos And Cut Throats: Inside Russia’s Only Tank Factory
item.description: Many reports of problems at Russia's UVZ tank factory from open sources suggest that it may be producing far fewer tanks than some analysts believe.

item.title: What happened at Davos was a warning to CEOs: their companies are designed for a world that no longer exists
item.description: When allies hedge, CEOs must decide.

item.title: Did Target’s CEO miss the mark by ignoring Minnesota?

Government shutdown will delay release of January jobs report
item.description: The partial government shutdown that began over the weekend will delay the release of the January jobs report slated for release on Friday.

item.title: Here's when taxpayers will get their refunds

item.title: SpaceX officially acquires xAI. Here’s how Elon Musk justifies the move.
New SNAP work requirements take effect in more states under Trump-backed law
item.description: New SNAP work requirements are taking effect in additional states, expanding eligibility rules and reshaping benefits under a Trump-backed law.

item.title: Costco issues recall notice for bakery item due to undeclared allergen
item.description: Costco has recalled mislabeled "Mini Beignets filled with Caramel" that could cause allergic reactions due to undeclared tree nuts in 22 states.

item.title: Trump picks veteran staffer to head Bureau of Labor Statistics

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
